text: the first movie I remember seeing I
remember very vividly is the blob with
Steve McQueen and I saw it when I was
four years old and I don't know what my
parents were doing or friends of the
family who took me to see the blob at 4
years old which is incredibly
emotionally irresponsible but I remember
being in the theater seeing especially
the red substance coming from the toilet
up and so from that point on so I'm for
almost 42 now so since from 4 to 42 I've
had a problem sitting on toilets it
scared the bejesus out of me as a kid
and I and funny enough I found out later
that I was named after Josh it not being
a biblical reference but that Josh I was
named after Steve McQueen and one in
dead or alive so then I had this you
know this extra connection with Steve
McQueen within the blob and then wanted
dead or alive but yeah that's the first
movie I remember seeing and it had a
deep deep impact on me which I think
it's one of the reasons why I decided to
do what I do because I needed to have a
deep impact on somebody else I had never
done anything on film before the Goonies
and auditioning for The Goonies which I
did six times two of which Spielberg was
there but I didn't recognize him because
I didn't know who you know I didn't know
what he looked like he was you know oz
at that point for me I had been through
probably what
250 300 auditions at that point I had
been told that was green a lot you know
I had heard the confession of Dan white
and a very revealing thing for me was he
kept saying this was an hour and a half
after he killed Harvey Milk and and
mayor Moscone George Moscone is his
fingertips were very hot he remembers
from one shooting to the other from
walking across the city hall from
masconi's office to to Harvey's office
that his finger-tips
were hot and I thought that was an
interesting thing somebody came up to me
during the milk premiere and said you
know I know W seen it I know George has
seen the movie and I was like really and
I didn't ask who it was and then the guy
kind of
and I couldn't validate the fact that he
had seen it but I started telling that
story and then people when people had
asked me to validate it I couldn't and
then Oliver ran into I think I could say
this
Oliver ran into Clinton in China and
Clinton told Oliver that he had loaned
George W Bush his DVD version of W and
that's when he saw it so I know w saw it
for sure
I did ask Oliver what Clinton had said
that George had said and he said he
liked it very much he thought there were
sad moments yeah Woody Allen saw saw W
and Woody Allen he sent me an email that
I have framed now that was basically
like I don't know if you remembered me I
direct no I don't know if you remember
me from Melinda Melinda I was the
director which I thought was funny I
play you know play what do you know I
play I play a failed writer I play what
do young but I tell him I told him I
said I can't I'm not gonna make that
mistake and try and play you but it's
funny how he gets you to do is I don't
get woody at all and I think that's why
we get along so well so I go yeah okay
I'll do it
and my first suggestion that he'd be in
a wheelchair and I wrote a 3-page e-mail
to him of why I thought he should be
I have quadrupoles or some kind of
ambulatory ailment and his response to
me was no I can hear him now you want to
change the dialogue you know you can
change the dialogue if you want you know
whatever makes you feel most comfortable
and and I'd go okay and then I'd start
to change the dial and he goes but
that's not the dialogue so it's it's
crazy which I enjoyed I enjoyed the
insanity of it but it is insane
nonetheless is it harder to die or is it
harder to kill somebody as an actor I
don't like killing as an actor when I
shot Sean's character in milk we there
was a lot of joking going on at the
moment because we couldn't deal with the
intensity of it
I would much rather be the person dying
than the person killing I had to
confront the guy who was writing me I'm
saying that he heard that I had really
shot the dog in no country and I had
really shot the dog in American Gangster
and it was the first time that it dawned
on me that I had killed two dogs in two
movies back-to-back I would never kill
that dog he was a great dog his name was
Scooby he was a sweet dog he was very
good actor he's not acting anymore he
retired if I did a scene standing up for
years and years and years and not on not
on stage but in movies where when I
would stand when I do a scene standing
up I'd have to extend my legs so hard
because my knees would be shaking so
much I even felt it recently I went and
presented at the Golden Globes and I and
I had to straighten my legs kind of
because my knees were shaking
I still get very nervous in front of
people maybe that's why I keep doing it
you know if one day I'm not nervous then
I'll probably quit
